title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, they reached out to me via recruiter and had an interview set up within 1 week of app. The interview was a breeze. There were 2 managers in the room. They took turns asking me different typical interview questions. For ex) strengths/weaknesses, tell me about a time you struggled with doing the right thing, where do you see yourself in 5 years etc
Interview Questions: Strengths/weaknesses

title: Clinical Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The online application was very quick and easy. A month later, they contacted me and asked to have a phone interview. It was a pretty relaxed experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your career goals.

title: Financial Analyst Ll Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and two in person interviews. Process takes about two and half months. All interviews were friendly and relatively easy but the test is very difficult and needs a lot of preparation.
Interview Questions: Leadership qualities, analytical skills

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The actual interview itself, was very laid back. The interviewer was very personable and down to earth. She made me feel like a person, versus just being another name on a resume.
Interview Questions: We more so described the position and my background and correlation between the two.

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Different for everyone, but for me: I had one phone call (30mins) interview, then I was invited to come in and see the lab and take a diagnostic test.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience.

title: Specimen Processor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got an email from the recruiter to set up interview on site. Panel interview with two people from the department I was applying for and two other supervisors. Fairly laid back interview.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you come in and someone isn't doing their share is the work and you have to do their work for them?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Can take any where between 3-6 weeks depending on hiring manager's timeliness. 
Interviews are not difficult, but can be excessive. I mean, it's an admin role, not the CEO. Maybe they understand how difficult it is to get rid of people once they are hired.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 2 years, in 5 years.
What is your greatest strength/weakness

title: HIM Senior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews, first one panel about two hours long.  Second interview one on one with supervisor and director.  Second interview lasted about three hours and ended with an offer.
Interview Questions: Why this company?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initially had a phone screening, followed by an on-site interview with the clinical manager, the lab staff and the PI.  Everyone was very nice and professional at the medical center. The interview overall was smooth.
Interview Questions: I was majorly asked about skill sets related to the job.

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with three individuals in back-to-back interviews that lasted a total of around 1.5 hours. I was given 15 minutes to edit copy that was filled with medical terminology so they could see my thought process and how I would edit to make it lay-friendly. The interviewers were very pleasant, and I thought the meetings went very well. I was told I definitely would be called back for a second interview--but I never was. It took two months from the time I applied until they filled the position, and six weeks of that was after my first interview.
Interview Questions: The following hypothetical situation was presented, and I had to explain how I would handle it: The deadline for a report to a foundation that gave to UT Southwestern is fast approaching. A doctor is supposed to prepare a report draft and send it to you for editing, but despite repeated requests, he sends it to you at 11:59--and it is filled with medical jargon that you don't really understand and would have difficulty editing on your own.  What would you do?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy 30 min interview. At the end of the interview they asked me to come back the following week to meet with the operations manager. Then the following week asked me to come back to meet the operations team. Overall great staff and very nice.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time you put a lot of effort into a task and things just did not go your way? 
What do you look for in a manager?
Why do you want to work here?
Tell me about yourself.

title: Management Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Manager called and did a phone interview, gave notice to come in for an interview in person. Got called in for second in-person interview with 4 people including the higher up manager. They were bringing others in for the remainder of the week.  You will then get notified by human resources. Overall, very comprehensive interview, but typical interview questions you can find online.
Interview Questions: Why UTSW? Tell me about a difficult time in your last position...how did you handle it? If I were to call your supervisor what are three words they would use to describe you.

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were very easy going, detailed job description, shared personal feelings about the department. I proceed to next step in the process. I will update if I get the position.
Interview Questions: Where did I see myself in 2 years?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with a group (team setting), very friendly  and personable. Felt comfortable meeting the team and the managers. Quick questions and easy going. Very informative. Manager was very friendly as well as the team. I got to see where my workstation will be and I had the chance to go on a little tour.
Interview Questions: What would you say are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 interviews for the neurology position at UT Southwestern of Dallas. there were 2 openings for clinics. I was hired for the Neuromuscular division in the Neurology clinic at UTSW. One of my good friends was hired for the Movement Disorders clinic. I didn't know whether I wanted to go the Neuromuscular or Movement Disorders clinics. however, I am so happy that I was able to get into the Neuromuscular clinic. I am surrounded by amazing doctors and I am so fortunate to have each provider as a resource that I can rely on to give me updated, factual, evidenced based information.
Interview Questions: How do you respond under duress?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, then in person interview. tell me about your undergraduate research. talk about your strengths and weaknesses. what was your undergraduate study? what was your degree in? what made you pick this job?
Interview Questions: tell me about your undergraduate research. talk about your strengths and weaknesses. what was your undergraduate study? what was your degree in? what made you pick this job?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview questions. Manager called and did a phone interview, gave notice to come in for an interview in person. Got called in for second in-person interview but this was with the higher up manager. If they both approve, you will then get notified by human resources. Overall, very comprehensive interview, but typical interview questions you can find online. Also, since the actual manager interviews you via phone and in person, you will get to meet who you will be working for.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult time in your previous work and how you handled it.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very nice people. They want you to feel at ease. They want to get to know you better and how you can contribute to the company and make them better.
Interview Questions: What would you offer if you came to work with us?

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The position was posted online. A personal statement, three rec letters, and Cv were required for initial screening. Screening included: phone interview, Skype interview, and onsite interview. The onsite interview was completed in under an hour.
Interview Questions: Why UTSW?

title: Accountant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview first, and then I received an  invitation for face to face interview. I had 2 rounds of office interview; With Accounting manager, and Accounting Director
Interview Questions: Can you explain one of your failures and how did you overcome it

title: Compliance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with hiring manager. Then face to face with hiring manager followed by a group interview. The group interview is really to see if you fit in with the culture. The questions are basic. If you pass all of those, last is an interview with the AVP.
Interview Questions: Asked me to expand on information in my resume; to give specific examples.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: it took me awhile to have interviews (about 3 weeks after I submitted my applications). Awesome opportunities to work with research experts. I think it's difficult to get a job without good references and experiences.
Interview Questions: what's your future plan?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: ***Have not received an offer or a rejection yet***Applied through employee referral. Very pleasant interview! The recruiter was fantastic at providing details during the phone interview and the department interview was with the assistant managers and a charge. Defintely did not feel like an interview because they are so easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient and why did you do it?

title: Medical Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is made up of two interviews, both of which are with faculty. There are no medical student led interviews when I interviewed. It was overall relaxed and conversational.
Interview Questions: I was asked about an ethics dilemma and asked whom I would've tapped on to form a expert committee to tackle the problem

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Be prepared to be treated like garbage if you apply here. They will have you fill out assessments and jump through all sorts of hoops to demonstrate that you are a testament of professionalism and integrity while they convey nothing of the sort in return. They make zero effort to communicate and hypocritically exude the exact opposite of what they claim to be. Just rather sickening to see the way they really treat people.
Interview Questions: Routine questions, your answers to which go into their magic ball/computator to come up with a secretive solution that tickles their fancy.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I came into the office to interview with 4 people. Nice and prepared. Took a while to hear back. They did keep me updated after I reached out. There should be more communication during the whole process.
Interview Questions: Why did you look into this hospital?

title: Regulatory Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed w/6 people in a 3 hour interview. Everyone was extremely kind--even the security when I did a drive by the night before.  Haven't heard back yet but I am hopeful.
Interview Questions: If I would be comfortable learning multiple systems as they, over the last year, have gone completely electronic except for informed consents.

title: Audit Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied and had to complete a three hour on-line assessment.  They scheduled the interview and the day of the interview they called and wasted my time stating that I had failed the assessment and that I should have got a pop up window after completing the assessment that told me that.  I think that their "assessment" process requires some additional work.  Not all assessments are predictors of performance.   Additionally, they need to figure out their interview process.  Don't schedule an interview just to tell them that there is no interview.
Interview Questions: They did not ask any questions other than to say the interview will not be scheduled based on results of the "assessment".  Period.  Perhaps they should look at the assessment process.

title: Educational Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied on May 17th. On May 30th I was contacted via e-mail by the Administrative Assistant to the Director of the department asking if I was available on June 2nd to interview. Luckily, I already had the day off for a doctors appointment. After I confirmed, I was e-mailed an itinerary with times and names of everyone I'd be meeting with and a campus map. I arrived in enough time to find my way around. It's so huge it's easy to get lost. I found the office and went in for my 3 interviews. Each person I met with gave me a perspective of the position. After my third interview, I was introduced to my potential co workers. Everyone was amazing and funny. It really eased the nervousness. 

By 5pm I sent thank you notes to everyone I met and 80% of them responded. I was in shock because no one ever replies. So it gave me a good feeling.... After 1 follow up request, I started to get really nervous....but after a few days I got an e-mail asking for my references (5 total;2 have to be past/current supervisors). I reached out to my references and begged them to complete it ASAP and they did....and the next day the HR Recruiter called and offered me the job.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with Med Hub?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Great people. Very easy to talk with and I was asked relevant questions about my research. I had a very positive experience with the phone interview. I look forward to hearing back from them
Interview Questions: What is your favorite part about working in research?

title: Claims Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant and approachable.  More of a sit down chat then a high pressured interview.  Made me feel comfortable.  It lasted about an hour and they were very informed on the company benefits and perks.
Interview Questions: Tell us something about yourself.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: First, I had a short phone conversation with one of the two people running the lab.  Asked me basic questions, such as when I'd be able to start.  In a few days, I had a more in-depth Skype interview with another person running the lab.
Interview Questions: How to do a PCR?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for position. Received e-mail from potential boss (PI). Then I had a phone interview with my potential PI and afterwards kept in communication afterwards via e-mail. Accepted offer a  week or two after phone interview, and started working about two months later.
Interview Questions: Research experience, publications, poster presentations, projects, skills etc.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy and comfortable process. They just  asked basic questions including my background and experience. It was about 20min interview with two managers, and held in school, not UTSW.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UTSW?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very laid back, process took between 4-6 weeks from interview to background completion and drug screening. Interview was with only the department manager over the phone and lasted an hour
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UTSW?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview: talking about the projects I have done. Questions are based on the projects. Mainly asking some algorithms I used. For example, what is Bayes algorithm? Which situation can use it. What’s its limitations?
Interview Questions: Bayes algorithm, convolutional neural network

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very professional. Recruiters make you feel comfortable to ease any nervousness. They are very knowledgeable when it comes to the position they are recruiting for. Seldom they relied on department manager to answer job specific questions.
Interview Questions: What are the toughest challenge and how did you overcome it?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I received a text message the next morning asking if I could do a phone interview the same day. The phone interview was with 3 people on speakerphone and it was a bit difficult to hear.  They started out the interview with a lot of statements about how much work it was going to be to have a job there and how busy they are. Something I thought was strange was that they mentioned how other nurses were going to give you a hard time and it's because they want you to be the best and it's just part of beginning your career. Being a new grad I did not expect to get the job but it was a good interview experience. I heard back by email within a week.
Interview Questions:
Why work in an outpatient clinic versus the hospital?
Why did you decide to become a nurse?
How do you triage patients?
A post op thyroidectomy patient's wife calls and says he has been bleeding from his incision for the last 40 minutes, what do you tell her?

title: Senior Payment Applications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
2 interviews are done.
You interview wirh a Supervisor with questions about tour skill set and questions about previous employees. The if you are recommended to the next level then the Manager interview. This is a good sign.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses. How do you handle conflict

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job on January 19th.  I was contacted(through e-mail) on February 2nd  to schedule a phone interview on February 3rd. I was then contacted on February 10th to come in and take a look at the lab I would be working in. I was offered the job on February 15th and then contacted by HR on February 27 for 5 references. I submitted the references and was offered the final offer on March 7th.
Interview Questions: What is you reason for applying for this job? What is your motivation? What is your strength? What is your weakness? Tell us about yourself. It was typical interview questions.

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview went very smooth, comfortable setting. HR was specific in outlining roles for the position. Asked about my past experience and qualifications as pertains to the role. Outlined company policies general work environment and conditions.
Interview Questions: How do you handle challenging situations at work, give an example of such and what did you do to have the issue rectified

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (McKinney, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Total hiring and interview process took approx 2 weeks. 1:1 interview with hiring manager, 1:1 with AVP, group interview. Typical behavioral employment questions and specific questions regarding the position. Did not speak to front line staff only upper management.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an upset physician?

title: Director, Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Grueling 3 hour interview with 12 people, 15 min each, with no prior information about the interviewers or introductions as we were shuffled to the new person. Some slated interviewers didn't show, and some tried to "trap" candidates by not introducing themselves nor their roles at the beginning of the interview. Most interviewers were genuine but being interviewed by that large of a committee conveyed that the department did not have a good grasp on what they were looking for in a candidate. Personally I felt most interactions were very positive but that the ones that didn't go well had an outsized negative influence on the process. I'd much rather have had a longer interview with the primary work team than a committee gauntlet with people removed from supervision. There were no second interviews and we could hear the other candidates' responses as we waited while we were interviewed in a public area.
Interview Questions: Asked everything from my background to how much I knew about the type of patient treated by their department to my vision for the position. Question type depended on the background of the interviewer and varied greatly from personal to technical questions.

title: Grants and Contracts Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
Initial communication was fine. Professional HR staff. Easy to find building. No follow up. Not even a thanks but no thanks. I even wrote a after interview email and got no response. 

Within 5 mins of interview of war told I'm over qualified. I mean I drove 1.5hrs so you could waste my time.
Interview Questions: what is your experience with grants

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I was asked all the usual interview questions and it was low key. I was basically offered the job on the spot, shown all around the clinic and introduced to everyone.
Interview Questions: Where did I see myself in 5 years.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Not very rigid and easy. It was intially group interview then this was further broken down to a one on one. The questions were very specific and to the point. All were attentive to assess the candidate for the job.
Interview Questions: what is the most difficult challenge you faced in your job

title: Diet Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Short and straight forward. It lasted about 30 mins. I was in the room with the manager and her assistant but the manager was the only one that interviewed me. She started asking basic questions and then showed me how the job looks like.
Interview Questions:
How do you define compassion? 
What's the difference between sanitation and cleaning? 
How do you handle drama at work? 
What's your weakness/strength?
etc.

title: Clinical Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Mesquite, TX) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and after a couple of days, received an email instructing me to complete an assessment. The assessment was basically a quick grammar test. A recruiter contacted me two weeks later for a phone interview; after a few questions, she scheduled an interview for me the following week. 
My one on one interview went very well and I received another call from the recruiter requesting 5 professional references. 
After that process is complete, I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: What steps do you take when dealing with a difficult patient?

title: Patient Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The interview procesa went well. I had 2 interviewers and they were great. I actually had some fun with them during the interview. I can't wait to be offered the job.
Interview Questions: My strengths

title: Project Manager-Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was with a panel interview with three managers. They asked several behavioral questions. They are very busy and have many openings. Management seemed very uptight and unfriendly. 

They said they would call back by the end of month, but didn't it. I still might because is the government and have a lot of red tape. I heard they are difficult to work with.
Interview Questions: What do you do to control your construction costs?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied. thru utsw website, as internal candidate (Admin Assistant) to a different dept.
Called by HR and had 1st interview 4 wks later with dept mgr. 
Was called back about 1 wk later to interview with doctors who I would be working with (3) on 2 different days about 10 to 15 min each.
Was called 3 days later to confirm that they thought it was good match. Moved to that dept 5 wks later (my old dept needed a linger notice which they basicallt worked out w the other office an hr)
HR knows how you've beed rated so that works in ur favor.
Interview Questions: Why did i wanted to move to their dept. ?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Once you submit an online application, if you fit the requirements HR will contact you and do a brief overview. They will what would you like to gain out of the job and etc. You're then contacted by the department for a over the phone interview and then likely in person interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UT and do you see yourself in this same position long term.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I wasn't interviewed through UTSouthwestern. I was a part of a separate auxiliary program that employed people with UT Southwestern. However, once I arrived they asked me a few questions regarding my background, education, and current aspirations for employment. The interview process was fairly decent, but it had its share of hiccups.
Interview Questions: Where do you currently attend college?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (New York, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process involved 3 main stages:
1. Emailing the Principal Investigator of the lab providing my cover letter and CV
2. Phone interview with the principal interview about why I am interested in this lab and how I can contribute
3. Attending on-site interview including a presentation of current research work, meeting with several groups of people from the lab to understand the research, funding and culture of the lab in greater details. This concludes with a meeting with the principal investigator by the end of the day.
Interview Questions: What are some of the areas in this lab where you see you can contribute?

title: Clinical Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was short and precise. Topics were very typical/ general to any other interview.  I had mine over the phone so it was much more relaxed than how I could've imagined it would've been in person.  Just be yourself and have a good time.
Interview Questions: What makes you feel right for this position?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, was contacted by HR within couple of weeks. I was asked all kind of behavioral questions. It felt like the HR did not want me to pass the interview. She sounded very uninterested. She straight away said we are not going to proceed with your application.
Interview Questions: Do you need sponsorship?

title: Security Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Did not make it to the interview process. The process you are you using doesn't give a real picture of who is being interviewed. The series of questions, disqualifies individuals without even knowing their History. Many of the question asked are not relevant to the position that you are applying for.
Interview Questions: How to refund money?  Is this question relevant to a security position?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview questions. The process took a month to get hired. I had 4 interviews, the first was a phone screen, 1:2, panel interview then met with VP. It ensured that we were a mutually good fit for each other.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by phone on a wends day scheduled an interview for the following Tuesday since the 31st was a holiday. Interview with the manager over admitting department and the manger over the department I would be in. Very relaxed interview,basically read questions off paper. Not really a conversation.
Interview Questions:
Difference between PPO,HMO,and work  Miscomp?
What's your definition of great customer service?
Biggest weakness?

title: EMT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview with HR, then had an in person interview with the supervisor.  It was over all very pleasant, everyone was extremely nice and seemed to enjoy working here.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to take the lead for your team.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: got an email to set up a call with the principal investigator in the lab for an initial phone interview, after the phone interview I was invited to come in for a formal in person interview with the entire lab (5-10 people). After the interviews I received a call from HR with the formal offer and I accepted over the phone and she set up my start date. It was all very structured and organized.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my past experience and school coursework.

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I had two phone interviews and I was flown out for the third in person interview. I did very good in all three interviews and my interviewer was very friendly and knowledgeable in the finance area. However, several months have passed and I still haven't heard whether I received the job or another candidate was offered the position.  Very Unprofessional
Interview Questions: How would you react if a fellow employee did not meet a deadline you have set?

title: Research Tech II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with several people that were in the lab for one on one interviews. I cam in once and interviewed with each of these people, one after the other.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my previous lab experience.

title: Postdoctoral Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
Sent letters of intent describing interest and potential projects
Principal Investigators interested in my application would invite me over and we would have an interview consisting of a formal presentation and informal one-on-one meetings
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: This was a panel interview. They started asking general questions about me and how I got into nursing and my strengths. They then asked LOTS of behavioral questions where they wrote down my answers as I talked.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose UT?

title: Clinical Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: You may interview with an entire panel or just a single manager; so be prepared for either. Also, if the department is really interested, you will likely have several interviews over the course of a few weeks. This is a state institution and there are over 12,000 employees at UTSW, and so you must be patient with the interview, hiring, and onboarding process.
Interview Questions: Describe a project you've directly managed or coordinated in your previous position

title: Education Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview that latest 30 minutes. If it wasn't for me asking them questions it wouldn't have lasted for an hour in which I made it. It was very vague and somewhat unorganized in a small hot office.
Interview Questions: What type of work had I done before?

title: Radiaiton Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: All day interview with several people in the department. Wear comfortable shoes as you will be doing a lot of standing and walking.  You are able to see the entire department and actually meet some of the staff.  There was a scheduled lunch with some of the RTT's that worked there.  During lunch they actually interview you too.
Interview Questions: Why should we choose you? Tell me something about you not on your resume'

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was easy. Human resources contacts you and provides all the details for you. They are kind, considerate and easy to work with. Once there they'll ask a lot of psychological and behavioral type questions. Parkland, Methodist Dallas, Medical City and UT Southwestern all ask the same questions. 

It's good for you to have some solid questions to ask as well. One interview I did, my questions drove the entire interview.
Interview Questions: Why did you become a nurse?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Laid back interview. Applied through Dallas Morning News when the division was under St. Paul Hospital. Received hiring offer by telephone later that day. Interview was with Director and a secretary from another department.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself.......

title: Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was extensive. It was a three interview process. One 15 minute phone interview and two in-person interviews. Once with directors, and the next with the VP and President of the department. It was challenging interviewing back-to-back because it was repetitive and the program for this position is new and there are not any true objectives in place.
Interview Questions:
What fundraising donor base have you used in the past?

What makes you most nervous about this position?

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I showed up to PI's office  for the interview and he asked me if I was familiar with this type of research (which I was). Then he proceeded with explaining the details. After that he asked what are my plans for the future and if there were any experiments or procedures I wasn't comfortable doing.  And then I went to meet with everyone in the lab and got a tour of the facility.
They called me that afternoon with the offer
Interview Questions: If I knew how a certain protein worked

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was a very positive one. Everyone was very helpful, very welcoming, and while I was nervous - I still felt confident. They are very willing to answer questions or concerns
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult situation?

title: Research Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
Full phone interview, then panel interview with managers. It's not too formal they really just want to see that you can contribute right away, know the details of research, and would be willing to work your schedule around patients treatments.

Then follow-up with PI's, a little bit more intense but still typically very friendly people. Very open with what the job will be like and the pros and cons involved.
Interview Questions: Typical STAR type questions where you would describe how you dealt with research specific problems.

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied in November and had phone screen, face to face early December which was a 4 hour process. Included testing, full panel with analytical team, Director, and Management. After constant communication  and reference check no offer was made. Entire process took nearly 3 months.
Interview Questions: How many gas stations are located in the state of Texas.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a great hour long interview with some of the lab personnel. I was asked a lot of questions about attitudes towards certain aspects of the job. 36 hours later I received a job offer with great pay! I am excited to start my new position
Interview Questions: I was asked questions about order of draw

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: As far as the interview process goes, in my opinion it was very relaxed. Depending on which supervisor/general manager you had (I went through the interview process twice after they found someone more applicable the first time.)
Interview Questions: How would you handle a unsatisfied customer?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: A group interview in which you are individually interviewed by each lab member. It lasted the whole afternoon since other prequalified candidates were also interviewed at the same time.
Interview Questions: What are your strength and weaknesses? What research have your done?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I've applied for a position at UT Southwestern, and the PI called me to ask a few questions about my resume. We pretty much went over my resume, asked me about my research, and relevant courses. The interview didn't consist of any technical questions, just resume review.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about your research?

title: Summer Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I contacted a lab and sent in my information (I was a student at the time). They had space in the lab and could use another unpaid intern and so I researched there for a summer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very short. Described his research and the position of the job. Asked about my lab experience. Then I got to ask more questions and take a tour of the lab.
Interview Questions: What are your goals? What lab experience have you had?

title: Accountant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: multiple interviews: phone screen with HR.  There was an in person  interview with supervisor, then senior leadership of dept.  This does vary depending on the dept.   Overall was a good experience
Interview Questions: Describe an experience you failed at a project

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. UTSW IT recruiting is extremely slow. Process took months. Finally HR personal called to phone screen me. In response to the next step, she said we will have you bring you in for an in person interview. The very next day, I got an email saying that this position is filled. I was confused by the process. I responded to the mail asking, Did UTSW already hire the BA personal while phone screening was going on? or what is the real hiring process in the IT dept? Of course I didn't get a response to that email even though the email was not an automated one but the address belongs to an IT employee.
Interview Questions: What is the responsibility of a Business Analystt

title: Safety Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and couple days later recruiter called to set up interview. Interview lasted about 30 minutes, asking me about my qualifications and letting me know exactly what I would be doing for company. No offer was made or salary negotiations. Everyone I met with was very friendly and made the interview easy.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Phlebotomoist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple. It was a phone interview then personal interview. It went by quick and everyone made you feel comfortable. It was fairly painless in terms of time. I applied online and took about two weeks for a phone call back to set up the phone interview. The phone interview was quick and to the point.
Interview Questions: Previous Experience

title: Accounting and Fiscal Service Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied through campus career center.  It took 4 weeks to receive an invitation for face-to-face interview. VP and three managers interviewed me with a couple of behavior questions to know my background and my sincere interest in accounting.
Interview Questions: Describe a thing that you don't like.

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: 15 minute HR Phone Screen, followed by a 15 min phone interview with the hiring manager, followed by an in-person  team interview with the group. I got the call for the phone screen about 4 weeks after I applied online. Then there was a two week gap until the phone interview by the hiring manager, and again a 4 week gap until the team interview.
Interview Questions: What does Teamwork mean to you?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had to meet with the recruiter, then I met with 3 directors for interviewing. It was good, they all described to me what I would be doing and where I would work.
Interview Questions: What obstacles have you overcome?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from the nurse recruiter a few weeks after submitting an online application asking for references and a preferred interview time. I was flying in to interview from out of state (a phone interview option was not discussed) and she was willing to accommodate me with a time slot that accommodated my flight plans. The actual interview occurred in the department I applied for, with two RNs asking questions. They were friendly and not at all intimidating, which was reassuring for a new graduate. Most of the questions were situational/behavioral. They told me when to expect a call, and thanked my for traveling to interview in person. The interview itself lasted about an hour. I received an email with a job offer two weeks later.
Interview Questions: How do you personally promote patient safety?

title: Molecular Biologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a very formal interview. They greeted me with kindness and I greeted them the same way. It was a Panel of 2 people. They asked some basic questions, but it went really quick.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was working as a Temp for a few months and I applied for the full-time position online.  I'd already taken a skills test so I just needed to update my resume.  HR recruitment called me and let me know that a department was interested in interviewing me for the position and I accepted. Then they sent an email with interview date, time, location, and contact. The interview itself was pretty informal, the main interviewer was basically looking to see if we "meshed" well, as she said it.  We would be working closely together and I honestly think she was looking for a new friend... My test score and resume pretty much summed up all of the important information they needed to know.  We chatted very briefly about my experience and skills. The rest of the interview was small talk and I ended up asking more questions than they did me. Like I said, I think she was looking for a new friend.
Interview Questions: "Every now and then, longer hours are required to complete tasks.  Are you able to do this from time to time?" "What is your biggest weakness?" "Do you think you can handle working in an environment full of women?'

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was first contacted via email. Scheduled the interview over the phone. Spoke with the two research professors in charge of the lab. Did not last more than 30 minutes. It was not very technical or gruelling.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview process; phone, in-person, and 2nd in-person interview. Lengthy process due to schedule restraints of interviewers, but this is dependent on department. If an offer is made it is tentative on background, reference checks, etc.
Interview Questions: Not necessarily difficult questions or unexpected questions, but rather being prepared to provide samples of your work to fit the position.

title: Safety Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Ask questions about fire and life safety. Knowledge of NFPA, prior experience. Very slow process. Ask a lot of general questions about past history and what benefits are given to employees. You are given a good run around once the offer letter is sent. They say the salary is negotiable by t is most def not. You will either take what they offer or not accept the job.
Interview Questions: What NFPA Codes am I familiar with?

title: Lab Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted a month later by phone. 2 days later I received an e-mail with the date and time for the interview. The questions included why I chose to go the university I went to, about my future plans, and what my past supervisors might say about me. I was nervous with it being my first interview but the interviewer was pretty nice and chill. Be sure you arrive with plenty of time ahead to find the room of interview!
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions. Interviewer was just trying to know about me and my future.

title: Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a on-site interview for a job fair. Immediately interviewed with a RN and then she offered a job on her unit. Human resource person was there and explained the next steps. Now I have to wait to hear back to make a time to show them shot records and drug screening.
Interview Questions: All questions were well appropriated for the position. Just keep in mind how you will handle caring for more than 4 patients and what you believe the best actions are in that scenario.

title: Reimbursement Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I was recruited from outside of Texas. Therefore all interviews were conducted via telephone. A job offer was made without a face-to-face. They had the typical HR screening interview. One telephone interview with direct management and peer management. Final telephone interview was senior department management. Job offer was made within one week. Screening and background checks went through quickly. Was able to start work within 14 days of job offer including relocation. They did not offer assistance and relocation.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were fairly typical. The interviewers did not have a in-depth knowledge of the job function I was applying for.

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I interview through a College campus recruiting event. I interviewed with 3 people that took all 30 minutes, the group of people were kind and very nice. 

It was very easy, I just mainly talked about myself and my experiences. I believe Suresh is a straight shooter and offer a job on the spot. He was true to his word and I have a written offer. So if he says you have the job, then you have the job. 

Just be yourself.
Interview Questions: Who is my number one choice to work for?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was one interview...fast callback. The recruiter was very nice and organized. The interview was laid back and straight forward. The manager and charge nurse was very professional yet encouraging. They made a very nervoua new grad comfortable.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5yrs

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: be advised that the supervisors and managers are very slow to interview due to their own busy schedules.  HR does not provide initial interviews to assist departments in hiring staff, so be patient and call HR frequently after you apply for any positions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was called from a PI office that I didn't actually apply to and was offered a phone interview. From there an in-person interview with management, PI, and Co-PIs. Both interviews were pretty typical of interviews. Nothing hard to answer. Asked about my experience and goals, etc.
Interview Questions: Just general interview questions. Asked about experience, etc.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied through a reference and got selected directly for the in person interview. The interview took at the most 30 minutes. Only HR questions were asked with experience related being the main ones.
Interview Questions: Experience in matlab

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the PI directly by email to set up an in person interview or a phone interview if I was not local. The initial interview lasted about an hour and a half. The PI was interested in my lab background, career goals, why I had left previous positions, and what I wanted out of a new job.
Interview Questions: How to do molarity calculations.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Took forever. I applied in the fall and didn't hear back until around 6 months had passed. Interview process moved fairly fast as soon as I had my interview. I was working in less than a month after I viewed the lab.
Interview Questions: N/A They just asked about past experience and if I was willing to learn

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It depends on the person. Some will have phone interview and then in-person interview, some just in-person. It helps to read the research beforehand so you have something to discuss. Usually if you have no prior experience in a research lab, the chances of getting the job are lower which is dumb considering you are going to be trained for a few months.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary

title: Senior Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: On-site one-on-one interview with laboratory PI and lab members. Also met with key departmental and core facility directors. Toured facilities and laboratories. Attended seminars during the day. The whole process lasted about 5 hours.
Interview Questions: What are my long-term career goals and I do see myself staying in academic research? If so, in what type of role?

title: Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process, for me, was really easy. I applied for the job, they brought me in to interview. I interviewed with 4 different people in the department. Then, I got a call about 1 week later saying I got the job.
Interview Questions: Have you ever ran a red light?

title: Financial Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was one of the most extensive I've went through. It was literally a panel of people, this was definitely my longest interview process. Be prepared to get lost if you arent familiar with the campus, I would arrive much earlier than scheduled or come before you interview to find your building. HR took about 3 weeks to get back with me, I thought surely I did not get selected. The good thing is that HR is pretty good with matching you up to new opportunities that fit your skill set.
Interview Questions: how familiar are you with the peoplesoft system?

title: Research Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their career website and I was contacted a week or so later with an interview offer. I interviewed and was invited back for the second interview. Unfortunately I wasn't offered the job but I had to contact them.
Interview Questions: There weren't any difficult questions at all. Basic "where do you see yourself in 5 years" types of questions.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Rhetorical. Seemed last me the management had no actual experience in their jobs and were reaching to pretend to know what was going on. They were actors and nincompoops. It didn't get better.
Interview Questions: Wh do you want yo work.for morons?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Two-three rotations your first year. Whether you end up in the lab you like is up to how hard you worked, whether the head of the lab likes you and your science, and the lab's funding.
Interview Questions: What do you do if your experiment fails.

title: Adm Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview very simple and straightforward . The questions were nice and easy and didn't have any trouble answering . Everyone was nice and sweet during the process and I accept the offer .
Interview Questions: Why do you need this job ?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application on-line. Phone interview describing software development background. In person interview.
Interview Questions: Please describe a current software project.

title: Accountant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I Applied begging of Feb. Was called  a week later to interview with Director and Department supervisor. Received offer four days later. After offer is accepted you must pick up offer letter in person and sign with Human resources as this is the company process.
Interview Questions: Interview was very basic questions regarding budgets and general ledgers.

title: Clinical Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by the Clinical Research Coordinator within 2 days of applying. She was very nice, friendly, and professional. The process takes a long time from start to finish due to being in the healthcare field. I submitted an application in the beginning of January, was interviewed in early February, and was not officially hired until the end of March.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions if you prepared yourself well.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and smooth. Just some basic technical questions and calculation. Explain the job responsibility to me and the ongoing projects. Ask for some specific details for my career planning. Basic questions about my resume and the normal behavioral questions often heard at an interview.
Interview Questions: what is your strength?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and then got an e-mail from on the the faculty to invite me take a tour about his lab. The interview was ok, it was not like normal industry interview, he just explain what their research focus will be and ask about my future plan. Overall it was a pretty good experience.
Interview Questions: About my future plan.

title: Interpreter/Translator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was called by recruiter to meet with manager after  I  emailed them following up on my application. She called back to say the manager at the time wanted to interview me.  I was not selected the first round but the person hired fell through and then they called me back for another interview and I got hired.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a co-worker was constantly rude to you?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
Call in for a face to face interview. Give me the place and time for interview.
Ask me about my future plan and my previous work I have done before.
Give me some detail description for what I will working on.
Show me around the place that I will working in.
Interview Questions: Why I quit my previous job?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The department secretary called me up to break the news of my impending interview. She gave me a place and a time, as well as the name of my prospective employer. If I properly recall, there was only a couple days' interlude between the secretary's initial phone call and the face-to-face interview with my PI. I slipped into my best suit and sauntered on down to campus. The layout at the facility is somewhat complicated, so I took care to familiarize myself with a map beforehand. After I found his office, I gave the door a couple of knocks and he invited me in. This job was my first foray into research, and he wasn't expecting much in way of experience past what I had done in my undergraduate lab classes. He asked about my future plans, and once he was convinced I wasn't completely insane, he filled me in on the finer details of the project. Afterwards, we went on a tour of the laboratory and met what would turn out to be my future coworkers (I didn't know at the time). The rest is, as they say, history. He called me a week later offering me the position.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans?

title: Senior Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Called by secretary to meet with Primary Investigator, filled out HR paperwork, received call from PI that I am hired but have to go through red tape with HR, HR would not allow higher salary offer, phone call from HR to discuss non-negotiable salary request (UTSW is 20% BELOW Dallas, TX equivalent academic institutions/industry) as it is noted that one should be honored to work at such an institution.  Discussed alternative options to ensure increase in salary at earliest time with PI.  Then, I finally took the offer.
Interview Questions: Questions about previous lab/experimental experience.

title: Clinic Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: You definitely need to apply online. No one will talk to you about a job until you apply online and have your testing completed. To complete the testing you need to call HR and ask for the recruiting department. At that time they will schedule you for testing.
Interview Questions: Just be ready to answer questions about your previous experience. They are interested in know about you to get an idea of how you will work well in the area you are applying for.

title: Spanish Interpreter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview was formal with the HR department. They made me feel at ease though. Then I was interview by the department manager and asked me basic questions about my experience and qualifications. Interview Questions:
The interview was pretty much standard so there wasn't really an unexpected question. Having said that, I did went into a little trouble during the mock exercise described below.

In the mock exercise there was one word during the interpretation I hadn't been exposed in the past and went blank for a moment. I was able to overcome that and went ahead to finish with the rest of the exercise.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX)

This does happen, but the  norm is  to send your application online, you can choose to be considered for various jobs with the same CV.  HR will email you if they think you could be a good fit, sometimes they will contact you not for the position(s) you applied for,but will present you with other opportunities.  You will first have to set up an appointment to get tested at HR.  In my case the dept. called to set a date and tell me who i was going to interview with (department admi coordinator, then dept. mgr,  finally my direct boss.  She ended not being available, and after  1-on-1 interviews with admin coord and department mgr, they re-schedule for the next week.  My interview with the boss seemed to be more pro-forma, I had been approved by the other levels, and it seem to see if "the vibe was good"  It was so, that say was ok. she after my interview the I was asked to arrange with HR to present my application and arrange to get  tested.  Not very much room for salary negotiation at this level,

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Had to go through multiple interviews, starting in HR and ending with actual employees on the unit.  First step: HR department.  Had to do phone interview, then in person interview.  Once pass that, then you take behavioral tests (I think there were 3-4 tests).  If you pass those tests, then you get set up for an interview.  Second step: unit management.  In person interview with managers first.  If you pass that, then you come back to meet with some of the actual employees you will be working with (picked by the management).  If the managers and employees agree to like you, then you go forward.  Third step: Offer.  You get a phone call from the managers on unit or from the HR rep to discuss an offer, including salary.  If you agree with what they offer you, you accept!
Interview Questions: The most difficult questions asked were the typical ones you get asked on most job interviews.

title: Administrative Assistant- Doctor's Office Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Hiring and application process was lengthy; many forms to be filled out & submitted. Interview went well, but when I asked about specific job duties, the recruiter & EA couldn't specifiy what I would be doing. Great interview with the doctor, but he too couldn't be specific as to what my duties would be. Found out my first day that his previous admin had retired 9 months earlier, & no one knew her filing system or how to do her job. other admins had taken over a few duties, but I was told upfront that no one could train me. I was told to simply make it mine, meaning create my own job role. I was also told that several of my days each week would be spent riding the campus shuttle, carrying patient files to various offices. That detail was not mentioned during the interview. Other bad surprises came up throughout my first day, & I decided to make my first day my last! I gave this feedback to the recruiting team, but I don't know if anything has changed. Also a big surprise was that it was mandatory that I have parking fees deducted from my paycheck. Had i known that I was required to pay for my parking, that fact would've played into my overall consideration of accepting the job, & would have definitely made me negotiate a higher salary to cover this monthly cost.
Interview Questions: None, really. I had the experience they were seeking, and my skills were transferable to the needs of the job. I was able to answer all interview questions easily.

title: Senior Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UT Southwestern Medical Center (Dallas, TX) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Once the online application is completed and reviewed, a human resources person or recruiter contacts the applicant. If the applicant meets the requirements of the position, their application is then forwarded to the hiring manager for that position. If the applicant is selected for an interview, the recruiter then contacts the applicant to schedule the interview with the hiring manager. Prior to the interview, the applicant meets with the recruiter or human resources person to discuss details about the hospital, department, salary and benefits offered. The applicant then proceeds with the interview with the hiring manager, that usually takes place in that manager's office. Depending on the position, the applicant may also meet with other leaders that have a stake in the hiring decision and this may occur during the initial interview, but the applicant may also be asked to come back for this as a second phase to the interview process. Once this is completed, HR or the recruiter will contact the applicant to let them know the hiring decision made at that time and how the applicant will proceed if applicable.
Interview Questions: No questions stood out as difficult or unexpected, but I was very prepared. My advice is have a couple of questions pre-formulated to ask the interviewers because they will ask you if you have any questions for them. Also, during the interview, try to come up with a question or two to ask that are specific to what was discussed in regards to the position, manager or department.
